compbio.conservation
Class ExecutorFactory

java.lang.Object
  compbio.conservation.ExecutorFactory

public final class ExecutorFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Constructs and stores an instance of the ExecutorService for use by the clients. For AA Conservation calculation, the best executor to use is the one with the fixed thread number equals to the number of CPU cores and Blocking queue as the task queue. Executors.newFixedThreadPool(threadNum);

Author:
Peter Troshin

Method Detail

initExecutor

public static void initExecutor(int procNum,
                                java.io.PrintWriter statWriter)
Initializes the executor and stores its instance in the local static field. Only one instance of the executor is kept at any time. If the executor is re-initialized with a different number of threads (procNum) then it is up to the caller to make sure that that all previous scheduled tasks have completed. Something like the following can be used to ensure that all tasks have been completed: 
 executor.shutdown();
 
 executor.awaitTermination(60, TimeUnit.MINUTES);
This code will cause the executor to wait for a maximum of 1 hour for all scheduled tasks to complete. If this method call with the executor instance already initialized, then executor.shutdownNow() method will be invoked and all unfinished tasks are cancelled.

Parameters:
procNum - the number of thread to initialize executor with. For the purpose of AA conservation calculations for the maximum performance it is recommended that the procNum is equal to the number of CPU cores. procNum must not exceed 2xcores. If it does, then it will be initialized with the n cores equal to the number of CPU cores on the machine and the error message printed to the standard error stream.
statWriter - the PrintWriter to dump the execution statistics to.

initExecutor

public static void initExecutor(int procNum)
Initializes the instance of the ExecutorService with a number of computing thread equals to procNum. The execution statistics is voided.

Parameters:
procNum - the number of threads to use

initExecutor

public static void initExecutor()
Initializes the instance of the ExecutorService with the number of threads equals to the number of cores available on the computer. The execution statistics is voided.

initExecutor

public static void initExecutor(java.io.PrintWriter statWriter)
Initializes the executor with the number of threads equals to the number of cores available on the computer. The execution statistics is dumped into the statWriter

Parameters:
statWriter - the PrintWriter to dump the execution statistics into

getExecutor

public static java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService getExecutor()
Return the executor which were initialized. Please note that one of the init methods of this class must be called to initialize the executor before this method!

Returns:
the ExecutorService
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the executor has not been initialized yet
